Description: Sherd from black-figured pottery oenochoe; outside, parts of body and tail feathers of a cockerel (?) to left; inside, white slip (Prins).
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Leiden University, Faculty of Archaeology. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Description after Prins de Jong 1925, 58 no. 5. The white slip, with 'much mica', on the inside is puzzling.
Bibliographic references: Prins de Jong 1925 / Scherben aus Naukratis: Aus der Sammlung des Universitäts-Professors Dr Fr W Freih von Bissing (p. 58, no. 5)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1237)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: VII.5 (cat. no. in Prins de Jong 1925)
